raw_comment:
What do you notice?
I noticed that a lot of people from throughout the world are saying that the world is getting better. There isn't an extremely low percentage in any place of the world.

What do you wonder?
I wonder why the people who have lower percentages think the way to do, and same for the people with high percentages.

How does this relate to you and your community?
It relates to me and my community because the US has some of the highest percentages for young adults that believe the world is getting better. It shows we are a positive country.

What’s going on in this graph? Create a catchy headline that captures the graph’s main idea.
"The World is Getting Better, Day by Day"
ace_sentences: Many people from many countries say that the world is getting better.
No place in the world has an extremely low percentage.
I wonder why people with lower percentages think in that way.
I also wonder why people with higher percentages think in that way.
This relates to me and my community.
The US has one of the highest percentages of young adults who believe that the world is getting better.
This shows that the US is a positive country.
The headline is: The world is getting better day by day.
